Crimes.Dispute_Type: Criminal dispute involving extortion and retaliation

Crimes.Threat_Source: Corrupt police officers and Los Zetas
Crimes.Aggravating_Factors: Perpetrators were state actors linked to organized crime
Crimes.Mitigating_Factors: Applicant reported the crime to authorities
Crimes.Prior_Criminality: Not applicable to applicant; perpetrators had criminal ties
Crimes.Criminality_Severity: High – involved physical assault and threats
Crimes.Evidence_Sufficiency: Sufficient to establish incident but not nexus to Convention grounds
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Credible, but insufficient to prove persecution on Convention grounds
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant found credible, but claim failed on legal basis
Crimes.Risk_Assessment: Risk of further violence from criminal organization
Crimes.Targeted_Victimization: Yes, due to refusal to pay extortion
Crimes.Geographic_Context: Mexico, high levels of organized crime and corruption
Crimes.Jurisdiction: Mexican authorities, Canadian refugee determination system
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Sections 96 (refugee) and 97 (person in need of protection)
Crimes.Procedural_Stage: Judicial review of Refugee Protection Division decision
Crimes.Legal_Procedure: Refugee appeal and federal court judicial review
Crimes.Government_Body_Involved: Immigration and Refugee Board (IRB), Federal Court of Canada

Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Nexus to Convention grounds, personalized risk

Crimes.Legal_Standard: Well-founded fear of persecution or personalized risk
Crimes.Basis_for_Decision: No nexus to Convention grounds, generalized risk
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Denial: Failure to meet criteria under s. 96 or s. 97
Crimes.Basis_for_Inadmissibility: Not inadmissible, but failed to qualify for protection

Crimes.Accusation: Being targeted by Los Zetas for resisting extortion
Crimes.Risk_Persecution: No – risk deemed criminal, not persecutory
